THE WEEK

Sport
24 September 2021
main headline

IN DEPTH
A guide to the 43rd Ryder Cup
Team USA and Team Europe will go head-to-head this weekend in the 43rd Ryder Cup. Starting today at Whistling Straits in Kohler, Wisconsin, golf’s match-play tournament will see the European squad aim to defend the trophy they won in France in 2018. READ MORE ▸
main headline

TEAM USA vs. TEAM EUROPE
Captains and players

Team USA squad


Team Europe squad


READ MORE ▸
main headline

HOW IT WORKS
Format and scoring

What is the format?

The Ryder Cup has always been decided by match-play, pitting the players against each other rather than the scoreboard. There are 28 matches, each worth one point to the winners.

The first two days see foursomes in the morning, followed by fourballs in the afternoon. Fourball matches involve four players, two from each side, and the player with the lowest score wins the hole for his team. Foursomes is more like doubles, with two players from each team taking it in turns to take a shot. Sunday, the third and final day, will see 12 singles matches take place.


How does the scoring system work?

There are a total 28 points up for grabs. The winner of each match gets one point, with half points for drawn games. Europe, the defending champions, require 14 points to retain the trophy, while the USA will need 14½ points to win it back.
READ MORE ▸
main headline

SCHEDULE
Today’s tee times and TV coverage

Friday foursomes (US vs. Europe)


Friday fourballs


All times are BST - Wisconsin is six hours behind the UK

How to watch the Ryder Cup on TV

Sky Sports has the exclusive UK TV rights for the 43rd Ryder Cup. As well as live action from Whistling Straits, the broadcaster will have round-the-clock coverage and documentaries on its dedicated Sky Sports Ryder Cup channel.
READ MORE ▸
main headline

IN FOCUS
History and drama of golf’s biggest event
The three-day match-play team event is arguably the biggest spectacle on the golfing calendar. It is certainly the most keenly anticipated showdown for golf fans, as the two teams from opposite sides of the Atlantic fight it out for the coveted golden trophy. READ MORE ▸

Picture of Vishal Gupta . . 	
TOC syllabus and Monday's Tutorial
  	

Hi

Instructions for Operating Systems Compree Exam

 

* Compree exam will be held on 21/12/20 from 10.00 AM to 12.00 noon

*The exam will consist of two parts

*Part A will be multiple choice questions and will be of 1 hour duration. It will consist of 50 MCQs. Each correct answer will carry +1 mark and each wrong answer will carry -1 mark. Not attempted questions will not carry any marks.



*Part A will start at 10.00 AM. Students should login in their NEW nalanda account to take the test

*Part B will be long answers which have to be answered by hand and uploaded

*The time for attempting Part B and uploading the answers is 1 hour

*The Google form link for Part B will be shared through Google meet at 11.00AM

11481001322_CS F415 » Forums » Announcements » Compre marks and guidelines
Picture of Poonam Goyal . 	
Compre marks and guidelines
  	


       I.          All rechecks for all the components are done. Check and report immediately.

      II.          All the copy cases in labs are given zero. No penalty is given as for now.

    III.          Copy cases for comprehensive exam are also given zero. No penalty is given as for now.

 

Marking for comprehensive exams.

1.      A measure and justification why this measure should be used. Answers which describe both clearly will fetch full marks.

2.      All four cases described in the question should be explained … how the proposed method would handle them. Answers which describe all four clearly will fetch full marks. Partial marks are given according to the appropriateness of the method.

3.      (a) No partial marking

(b) Marks given only if FP tree method is used to find frequent item sets. Partial marking has been done.

4.      Output of each algorithm has to be given with justification. Partially correct arguments are given partial marks.

5.      Ques 5

a.       50% marks for the answers which have only distance matrix

b.       Without justification and calculation only 2/6 marks are given

c.       Answers with proper justification and labeling as core, border and noise fetch full marks

d.       Ideal matrix – 3/5 marks, comparison with similarity matrix 2/5 marks

e.       Partial marks for partially correct confusion matrix

f.       Need to calculate 3rd NN for every point, plot them in sorted order and cut the graph. Without NN distance zero marks given.

 

If you wish to submit a recheck for comprehensive exam, first go through this document then only apply for it. Unnecessary recheck will lead to critical and final evaluation of the whole copy.

You can apply for recheck by tomorrow (22nd Dec 2020) 12 noon. Late requests will not be considered. (scores will be released by tonight)

11461001094_CS F211 » Forums » Announcements » DSA Compre on Dec 28, 2020
Picture of Vishal Gupta . . 	
DSA Compre on Dec 28, 2020
  	

Hi


a) Time of the exam is from 10 AM to 12 Noon.


c) Your camera would be ON during the entire duration of the test. So, arrange for it in case you don't have.

d) Syllabus for the same is the entire syllabus covered in the lectures. The exam is open book.

e) Exact format of the exam would be informed before the exam. You should arrange for A4 size sheets (or equivalent), download necessary app for scanning your work and converting it into pdf file (e.g. camscanner).

f) Make sure that Internet connection is proper, battery backup is there, etc. It is solely your responsibility for doing all the necessary arrangements for giving the exam. No makeup would be entertained for failure to do so.

Picture of Shashank Gupta . 	
Marks, Solutions and Evaluation Criteria of Mid-Sem
  	
Archive (RAR) Solutions and Evaluation Criteria.rar

Hi,

The marks for mid-sem of compiler construction are released on your Nalanda accounts. Please refer the attached solutions and evaluation criteria.



Note that recheck request will be considered only till tomorrow (i.e. 28-03-2021) by 12 noon. Recheck request will not be considered on emails in any case.

Guidelines for Quiz II of Compiler Construction (CS F363)
  	


- The test will be conducted through the Google Forms and duration of Quiz is 30 minutes. 


Sr. No.
	

BITS ID (From -To)
	

Invigilator
	

Google Meet Link

1.
	

2015A7PS0120P- 2017B1A70991P
	

Dr. Shashank Gupta
	


2.
	

2017B3A71005P- 2018A7PS0229P
	

Dr. Vinti Agarwal
	


3.
	

2018A7PS0230P- 2018A7PS1121P
	

Mr. Yemini Ashok
	


- If anyone has difficulty in finding his/her BITS ID from any of the above three S.No., he/she can join any one of the above Google Meet Links.


- Ensure Internet connectivity, camera, Laptop, and any other thing required. 

- The test would be Open-Book and can contain short answer questions, long answer questions, MCQ’s, etc. 

- Any announcement would be done using these links; so please have access to headphone during the test. 

- The google form link of attendance and Quiz II can be only accessed from the chat box of Google meet sessions.

Dear All,


Currently all the notices are sent through e-mail. The present system supports mainly three groups namely student, Faculty and staff. The mails can be sent to individual groups or to multiple groups. The present facility does not offer mail delivery to the fine grained targeted email groups causing the individual mailbox cluttering.  

The team of IPC and SDET has taken up a new initiative and they have created a portal which  aims to provide a single dashboard for the posting and access to the various notices/announcements.

To begin with , we intend to provide notice posting rights to Head of departments, division heads, faculty-in-charges  and unit heads. Once the facility is operationalized, the root email facility will be withdrawn. The individual faculty members will continue to use the Nalanda email/announcement  facility to send the course related communication to the students. 
Hoping for your kind cooperation.

With the best regards,

Sudhirkumar Barai
Director, BITS Pilani-Pilani Campus

Dear all,

 


 

  


The users can login to the portal using their Official BITS e-mail Id  to register the complaint. Once the complaint is registered , IPC technical staff  would attend the call and make an effort to resolve the issues. 

 


 


 


 

·         Passwords must not contain the user’s account name or parts of the user’s full name that exceed two consecutive characters
·         Be at least eight characters in length
              o    English uppercase characters (A through Z)
              o    English lowercase characters (a through z)
              o    Base 10 digits (0 through 9)
              o    Non-alphabetic characters (for example, !, $, #, %)

 




 


 

1.  Users are not allowed to install personal software for use on BITS Pilani’s computer systems. Users are not allowed to download / install unauthorized / pirated software for use on BITS Pilani’s computer systems and their personal system when it is connected with BITS Pilani’s network.

2.      Users shall not make unauthorized copies of copyrighted software and documents, except as permitted by law or by the owner of the copyright. Copyrighted materials belonging to the entities other than BITS Pilani may not, subject to the allowable exemptions, be transmitted by faculty, staff or students on BITS Pilani mail / internet system. Setting up a file sharing service (within LAN) which violates Intellectual property rights is not allowed. All users obtaining access to other companies’ or individuals’ materials must respect all copyrights and may not copy, retrieve, modify or forward copyrighted materials, except with permission of the copyright owner or as may be permitted under the appropriate law. Each user shall observe all terms and conditions of the license agreement, under which the license to use any copyrighted work has been obtained.

In case of any such violation ,the user shall solely be  held responsible and liable for the offence arising out of unlawful use of  copyrighted material / software. 



--

11511001330_MATH F441_AUG_2021 » Forums » Announcements » Quiz 1
Picture of Divyum Sharma . 	
Quiz 1
  	


Students who are not on-campus

    You are required to join Google Classroom and Mercer Mettl by 4.00 PM. Your videos must be switched on and 360 degree view must be presented whenever demanded by the invigilator. 
    Off-campus students who do not join Mercer Mettl for the quiz will be deemed absent.
    Mutual communication, internet browsing is not allowed. You can use hard copy/e-copy of textbooks and lecture slides (hard-copy or from Google Classroom).
    The quiz duration is 30 minutes and you will be given extra 5 minutes to scan and upload your handwritten solutions. Do NOT look at the time left on Mercer Mettl as that is set differently.
    Be sure to write your name and ID number on each page of the submission; otherwise the submission won't be graded. You can keep pages ready with your name and ID number written on them.
    Multiple submissions will not be allowed; your first submission will be considered final.
    Do not leave Mercer Mettl until asked to do so.

Students who are on-campus

    Please follow COVID protocols.
    Bring your ID card. You can bring textbooks (hard copy of textbooks or printout of relevant chapters) and printouts of lecture slides.
    Quiz will be given 30 minutes from the start. No one will be allowed to leave until the quiz duration is over.

11511001330_MATH F441_AUG_2021 » Forums » Announcements » Notice for Mid-semester examination
Picture of Divyum Sharma . 	
Notice for Mid-semester examination
  	

Discrete Mathematical Systems (MATH F441)

Notice for Mid-semester examination

 1.     The mid-semester examination for this course will be conducted on Monday 25-10-2021 from 9.00 AM to 10.30 AM. The maximum possible marks are 30.

2.     The examination will be conducted in off-line mode (physically in classrooms on campus) only. The seating arrangement will be in accordance with AUGSD notice.

3.     The examination will be closed book. Please bring BITS ID cards. 


5.     If you are unable to return to campus to take the mid-semester exam, you have to apply for the make up examination on academic.bits-pilani.ac.in  by 24-10-2021.

6.     If you have returned to the campus but are unable to take the exam for genuine reasons, you have to apply by email with evidence for genuineness by 26-10-2021.

From the desk of FIITJEE Chennai Centre Director


Hope this mail finds you in absolute spirits and good health. It has been a complete pleasure to connect with you yet again. I am extremely delighted to share my happiness over the recently declared JEE Advanced results 2021. FIITJEE has proved its legacy in winning par excellence. Our Student Anand Narasimhan from Chennai Centre has brought laurels and accolades by securing the All in Rank 17.

FIITJEE Chennai center has been triumphant in producing Tamil Nadu State Topper for the 14th year consecutively. FIITJEE Chennai center has bagged extraordinary results by securing a total of 15 ranks in Top 500, 28 in Top 1000 ranks and 51 in Top 2000 ranks with overall of 306 selections in JEE Advanced exams. At the National arena, FIITJEE has created a niche by securing a total of 6 in Top 10 ranks, 12 in Top 20 ranks, 18 in Top 30 and 36 in Top 100. FIITJEE student’s stands tall with splendid top ranks and emerge victorious in JEE Advanced 2021 exams, with overall selections of more than 4239 students at PAN India level.

On an average around 14-15 lakhs students appear for JEE Mains every year for the 16232 seats in IITs and only around 2 lakhs students get selected to appear in JEE Advanced. The students work meticulously to secure a rank in top 2000 to get their preferred branch/stream. It is quite obvious that securing a rank beyond 3000 would make it difficult for a student to select a stream of their choice. The above figures of the appearing students speak volumes of the fierce competition prevailing to get admitted in the IITs.

FIITJEE as an institute plays an important role in broadening the mental horizon of young learners and develop right attitude towards learning. It is quite important for us to understand that training students to ace in such competitive exams requires constant updation and to adopt strategies for effective teaching and learning.

“The capacity to learn is a gift; The ability to learn is a skill; but the willingness to learn is a choice”.

In our endeavors to promote serious learning FIITJEE urges every student to learn to utilize every moment of their life purposefully and productively. We believe that learning is a true treasure which will follow its owner everywhere; so cherish this treasure and be lifelong learners. Success is no accident, it is a culmination of hard work, perseverance and most of all love for what you are doing or learning to do. Let us strive to stay positive and derive happiness from whatever we are learning/doing.

FIITJEE makes a strong emphasis that school education is an integral part of student education. We lay focus on quality education and make sincere efforts to ensure that education is not limited to Curriculum alone. Our competitors in KOTA and Andhra Pradesh follow different strategies and part or compromise with the school education. FIITJEE on the other hand has been successful in delivering excellent to extraordinary results without compromising on the school curriculum amidst all potential competitors.

FIITJEE has been striving hard in our constant efforts to uphold our levels of commitment to students in providing an enriching and ethical learning environment. In 2019 one of the topmost coaching Institutes from Hyderabad lured our faculty and poached upon our top students and faculty by promising them with best coaching and took away our students to their institute. FIITJEE with its strong ethical values and principles overcome this challenge with utmost belief that Perseverance, hard work and abiding faiths are indispensable for attainment of excellence. Students who continued with FIITJEE performed better and secured better ranks. FIITJEE has always proved its excellence through one and only thing, its 'RESULTS'.

The toil of years, the sweat of your brow, the struggle you make, everything counts in achieving the goal.

Needless to mention, for securing a top rank in IIT there is no need to part with the school education nor be hooked with any strategy. FIIJEE strongly believes that its best training and teaching methodologies equip the students with all round capabilities in achieving benchmarking success in their academic pursuit.


Regards,

Ankur Kumar Jain

Dear Investor,
 
With reference to BSE Notice 20201217-54 dated December 17, 2020, 20210115-2 dated January 15, 2021 and 20210118-31 dated January 18, 2021, Stock Brokers are required to upload clients fund balance and securities balance on weekly basis.
 

Information pertaining to your fund and securities balance and last settlement date as on 18/09/2021  provided by MOTILAL OSWAL FINANCIAL SERVICES LIMITED. along with the details of securities ISIN wise is attached.
         1. Click on the attachment provided with this email.
         2. You will be prompted for your password.
         3. The password is your PAN Number in upper case
 

Please note that negative number in the file represents debit balance/balance payable by you. Also, the funds and securities balances provided are what is maintained with your broker and does not include balance in your personal bank account and demat account.
 
In case you find any discrepancy, we advise you to take up the matter immediately with your member. You may contact your stock broker at QUERY@MOTILALOSWAL.COM or 02240548000.                             

Do's & Dont's

1. Deal only with registered intermediaries - check the registration certificate of the intermediary you are dealing with. It allows recourse to regulatory action.

2. Beware of fixed/guaranteed returns schemes. Brokers or any of their representatives are not authorized to offer fixed/guaranteed returns on your investment or enter into any loan agreement to pay interest on the funds/securities offered by you.

3. Do not fall prey to emails and SMSs luring you to trade in stock/ securities promising huge profits.

4. Ensure to fill all the required details in KYC document by yourself and receive duly signed copy of your KYC documents from your broker. Check for all conditions that have been agreed and accepted by you.

5. Opt for electronic (e-mail) contract notes/financial statements only if you are computer savvy and have an e-mail account of your own. Don't ignore any e-mails/SMSs received with regards to trades done by you. Verify the details of the same and report discrepancy, if any, to your broker in writing immediately

6. Trade verification facility is also available on BSE website.

7. Check the frequency of accounts settlement opted for and verify your monthly/quarterly settlement statements. Any discrepancies observed therein should be brought to the notice of your broker in writing immediately.

Take Best Business Pictures With Just Your Phone - Advanced Tech Tips Blog
	

Take Best Business Pictures With Just Your Phone

iPrice

Before the rise of smartphones, taking a picture may be a difficult task especially to those with businesses. You'd have to get an expensive camera and editing software for your desktop computer, as well as devote a significant amount of time and effort to learn how to use them. Thanks to our smartphones, we now can capture high-quality images and edit them effortlessly. There are a few additional tools and accessories that substantially enhance your images. Here's how to take and produce stunning pictures like a professional with only your phone for your business. 

Get a good lighting for your shot
First and foremost, good lighting plays the biggest role in producing the best pictures. Due to their small sensors, only a few smartphones can generate outstanding indoor images. Hence, for the best effects, shoot images outside in the ideal lighting circumstances. Lighting affects not only the luminance of a photograph, but also the mood, tone, and atmosphere. 

When shooting outside, choose a time of day when the light is mellow, such as early morning or evening. This creates a soft, even light with pleasing tones. If you must photograph in direct sunlight, attempt to do so in the shade or angling your subject with the sun in your shot.
